name: Daniel Fields
summary: As a finance professional with experience in data analysis and problem-solving, I am eager to transition into the field of software engineering. My passion for technology drives me to continuously learn and adapt to new tools and programming languages, enabling me to build efficient and innovative software solutions. Having a keen eye for detail and a collaborative mindset, working closely with team members to create user-friendly interfaces by drawing from consumer feedback to develop cutting-edge software applications.
skills: JavaScript, React, jQuery, Express, Node.js, MongoDB, Mongoose, AJAX, Python, Django, Heroku, Netlify, Postman, Bootstrap, Google Firebase, APIs, PostgreSQL, GIT, GitHub, HTML5, and CSS3

projects.title: Blackjack Card Game
features: Develop a minimum viable product (MVP) for a web application for the card game Blackjack using HTML, CSS3, JavaScript, and jQuery.
Implemented AJAX to request and incorporate external data from the Deck of Cards API into the application
Used JavaScript and jQuery for game functions and logic
Designed and styled the application using HTML5, CSS3, and a combination of flex-box and grid layout

projects.title: Travel Application
features: Developed MVP for a full-stack travel app using Node, Express, MongoDB, JavaScript, EJS, CSS3, and Bootstrap
Utilized Fetch request to a 3rd party API to display the current weather of the travel location

projects.title: InvestApp
features: Team project of 4 to develop a single-page MERN-stack application, allowing users to invest in stocks.
Implement fetch request to backend API to gather and display stock data.
Make Fetch request to Stock API on the backend to seed local API

experience.title: Oil Derivatives Broker
responsibilities: Analyze market data and trends in rapidly changing market conditions to provide clients with informed trade ideas, resulting in a $700,000 gain for a specific client
Developed a new procedure for entering trades to reduce errors using Excel, resulting in a 95% decrease in errors
Collaborate with 4 team members to deepen client relations, resulting in securing a new $500,000 business client

experience.title: Analyst
responsibilities: Investigated and analyzed crude oil volatility to provide brokers with real-time analytics and trade ideas to present to clients, leading to an increase in our desk revenue of 15%
Developed an automated trade confirm program using Excel, reducing trading confirm errors by 85%, resulting in the implementation across departments company-wide

education.name: Pace University, Lubin School of Business
education.degree: Bachelor of Business Administration, (BBA) in Finance
